intro: Periandra mucronata, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its growth habit includes both woody and herbaceous forms, depending on environmental conditions. The leaves are typically pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets.
